# Authoring framework (10 min)

Rmarkdown is an authoring framework for data science^[or data-driven document] combining: 

* YAML header

* code (R code)

* narrative text (Markdown syntax). 

# Theory (30 min)

knitr package

## Writing

### Markdown syntax

Markdown syntax is plain text used in:

* GitHub
* Sketchfab
* Slack
* bookdown
  - @Hinz21 R handbook
* etc. 

Markdown supports HTML:

* <span style='font-size: 40px'>Big font</span>
* <b>bolded</b>
* etc.

Editing in RStudio, supports:

* BibTex objects:
  - 
* 3D objects
* videos
* etc.

Export Rmarkdown in:

* HTML
  - this Rmarkdown document/webpage
* PDF
* LaTex
* etc.


### Rstudio environment

* Navigate through the whole structure (bandeau)
* Go to the previous/next section/code chunk (up/down arrows)
* Insert a new code chunk


### Rmarkdown structure


#### Code chunks

* header
  - include
  - echo
  - eval
  - caption
  - etc.
* body
  - R code

#### Narrative text

Markdown syntax

* **bold**, *italic*, `code`, <span style="color:red">color</span>
* comments '>'
* [hyperlinks](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/)
* [bookmarks](#practice)
* lists
  1.
  2.
  3.
* dataframe
* footnotes^[I am a footnote]
* calls
  - variable: 'my.sum = `r my.sum`'
  - chunk
  - figure
* etc.

#### YAML header

* author

* date:
  - "03/02/22"
  - "3rd February 2022"
  - "`r format(Sys.time(), '%d %B %Y')`"
  
* table of contents (toc)

* bibliographic references

## Publishing

PDF, HTML, etc. Rpubs
